title: Applied Health Econometrics for HTA
description:
Health technology assessment (HTA) is a key healthcare decision making tool in informing allocation of scarce healthcare resources. HTA uses data from randomized controlled trials, observational studies and retrospective data sets to generate estimates of the cost and effectiveness of a new technology relative to the current standard of care.
This module is designed to equip students with critical econometric and statistical analysis skills to generate reliable effectiveness and cost estimates for HTA.
department: SSH School of Public Health Dean's Office
prerequisite: SPH5006 STATA Primer for Public Health
